lead_paragraph: Han Tak Lee, 81, who was wrongfully convicted of killing his daughter in a fire, spends most of his time now in his Queens apartment, getting by thanks to people who have sympathized with his plight.

headline.print_headline: Locked Up for 24 Years, an Exonerated Man Still Feels Trapped
headline.main: Locked Away for 24 Years, an Exonerated Man Still Feels Imprisoned

snippet: Han Tak Lee, 81, who was wrongfully convicted of killing his daughter in a fire, spends most of his time now in his Queens apartment, getting by thanks to people who have sympathized with his plight.
abstract: Interviews with Han Tak Lee of Queens, who was falsely convicted of murdering his daughter in 1989 and spent 24 years in prison, reveal that he continues to feel bitterness over his mistreatment by justice system; Lee struggles to make ends meet, surviving largely on Social Security payments and kindness of people who sympathize with his plight.
